personalInfo.name: Mohammad Reza Taghimomeni
personalInfo.bio: Specializing in creating high-quality, scalable web applications with modern frontend technologies.
personalInfo.aboutMe: I am a Senior Frontend Developer with extensive experience in React.js and Next.js, and a strong advocate for Clean Architecture and Test-Driven Development (TDD). My passion lies in building scalable, maintainable, and high-performance web applications. I thrive in collaborative environments, mentoring junior developers, and continuously learning new technologies to deliver the best user experiences.

description: Architected and implemented a comprehensive component library using React, TypeScript, and Storybook, improving development speed by 40% and ensuring UI consistency across multiple projects.
Led the migration of a legacy AngularJS application to Next.js, resulting in a 60% improvement in initial load time and significantly better SEO performance.
Mentored junior developers, conducting code reviews and pair programming sessions to foster best practices and improve code quality.
Collaborated with product managers and designers to translate requirements into technical specifications and user-friendly interfaces.
Developed and maintained features for a high-traffic enterprise application using React and Redux, handling complex state management and data synchronization.
Optimized application performance by implementing code splitting, lazy loading, and memoization techniques.
Integrated RESTful APIs and WebSockets for real-time data updates and interactive user experiences.
Participated in agile development processes, including daily stand-ups, sprint planning, and retrospectives.

projects.title: Nexus
achievements: Engineered 10+ responsive web applications and admin dashboards using React/Redux and Angular, incorporating 100+ reusable components alongside valuable development tools like plugins, mixins, and directives.
Spearheaded improvements in development, code review, release, and bug-fi xing methodologies within the team, leveraging Scrum/agile best practices for over 1000+ hours.
